name: bayesian-finemapping-deep-vi
title: Bayesian Fine-mapping with Deep Variational Inference
description: Perform Bayesian fine-mapping from GWAS summary statistics using deep variational inference
content:
Overview

This application implements a deep neural network-based variational inference approach to compute posterior inclusion probabilities (PIPs) and credible sets for putative causal variants from GWAS summary statistics and linkage disequilibrium (LD) information.

Features

  • Deep variational inference for Bayesian fine-mapping
  • Posterior inclusion probability (PIP) calculation
  • Credible set identification
  • Visualization of posterior distributions
  • Support for custom training parameters

Parameters

  • GWAS Summary: CSV/TSV file with variant_id, effect_size, pvalue, se columns
  • LD Matrix: Linkage disequilibrium matrix (.npy format)
  • Iterations: Number of training iterations (default: 5000)
  • Learning Rate: Optimization learning rate (default: 0.01)
  • Hidden Dimension: Neural network hidden layer size (default: 64)
  • Credible Threshold: Threshold for credible set (default: 0.95)
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

Output

The application generates multiple output files including fine-mapping results CSV, credible set CSV, PIP visualization plot, and a detailed analysis log.
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python "prod_apps/biomni/genetics/bayesian_finemapping_with_deep_vi.py" "${gwasSummary}" "${ldMatrix}" -n ${nIterations} -lr ${learningRate} -hd ${hiddenDim} -ct ${credibleThreshold} -o "${outputDir}"
